root:
The Porcupine
What! would you slap the Porcupine? Unhappy child—desist! Alas! that any friend of mine Should turn Tupto-philist.[B]
[218]
To strike the meanest and the least Of creatures is a sin,
[219]
How much more bad to beat a beast With prickles on its skin.
[220]
FOOTNOTE: [B] From τυπτω=I strike; φιλεω=I love; one that loves to strike. The word is not found in classical Greek, nor does it occur among the writers of the Renaissance—nor anywhere else.
